intro: Dracophyllum lessonianum, commonly known as the New Zealand heath, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal and montane environments, thriving in well-drained, acidic soils. Its small, bell-shaped flowers are usually white or pink, and it produces berries that are an important food source for native birds. Dracophyllum lessonianum plays a significant role in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
